definitions: moving, facing, or situated in the direction of east where the sun rises
coming from the eastern direction as wind or weather patterns do
examples: The ship sailed in an easterly direction toward sunrise
We took the easterly route through the mountain pass
Strong easterly winds brought rain to the coastal regions
The easterly breeze cooled the afternoon temperature significantly

definitions: situated at the most eastern point or position in a particular area or region
examples: Maine contains the easternmost point of the continental United States
The easternmost island in the chain receives the first sunrise

definitions: situated on or relating to the eastern part of a city, area, or region
examples: The eastside neighborhood has many historic buildings and parks
We moved to an eastside apartment closer to downtown

definitions: moving, leading, or pointing in the direction of east where the sun rises
examples: The pioneers continued their eastward journey across the plains
Birds began their eastward migration as autumn approached

definitions: having a calm, relaxed temperament that doesn't get easily upset or stressed
examples: Her easygoing personality made her popular with coworkers
The easygoing teacher rarely raised his voice in class

definitions: having a deep black color like the dark hardwood from tropical trees
examples: Her ebony hair contrasted beautifully with her pale skin
The piano's ebony keys gleamed under the stage lights

definitions: deviating from conventional behavior in a way that seems strange but harmless to others
having an axis or center that is not in the usual or expected position
examples: The eccentric professor wore mismatched socks and quoted poetry randomly
Her eccentric habit of collecting vintage typewriters filled three rooms
The eccentric wheel caused the machine to vibrate irregularly
An eccentric orbit brings the comet closer at certain times

definitions: relating to the Christian church, its clergy, or its formal religious practices and traditions
examples: The ecclesiastic authorities met to discuss important church matters
He wore ecclesiastic robes during the religious ceremony

definitions: relating to the Christian church or its clergy, especially in formal or official contexts
examples: The ecclesiastical court handled matters of church law and discipline
Medieval ecclesiastical architecture featured soaring spires and stained glass

definitions: producing sounds that repeat by reflecting off surfaces in diminishing volume
repeating or closely resembling something in theme, style, or meaning like an echo
examples: The echoing footsteps in the empty hallway sounded eerie
Her voice was echoing through the mountain valley below
His speech contained themes echoing his earlier campaign promises
The novel's ending was echoing the opening chapter's imagery

definitions: selecting or using elements from a wide variety of sources, styles, or ideas rather than one
examples: Her eclectic music collection ranged from classical to heavy metal
The restaurant serves an eclectic menu combining Asian and Mediterranean cuisines

definitions: relating to the relationships between living organisms and their environment or ecosystem interactions
examples: The oil spill caused severe ecological damage to marine life
Scientists studied the ecological impact of introducing new species

definitions: providing good value in relation to the money, time, or effort spent on something
using the minimum amount of resources necessary to achieve a desired result efficiently
examples: Buying in bulk is more economical for large families
This economical car gets excellent gas mileage for commuting
She gave an economical explanation using just a few words
The chef created economical meals that minimized food waste

definitions: feeling or showing overwhelming happiness, joy, or excitement that seems beyond normal control
examples: She was ecstatic when she received her college acceptance letter
The fans were ecstatic after their team won the championship

definitions: promoting cooperation and unity among different Christian churches or religions in general
relating to or representing the whole of a body of churches or being universal in extent
examples: The ecumenical service brought together Catholics, Protestants, and Orthodox Christians
They organized an ecumenical conference to discuss shared religious values
The ecumenical council addressed issues affecting churches worldwide
His ecumenical approach welcomed ideas from all religious traditions

definitions: having a border or boundary of a specified type around the outside
having sides or boundaries that are sharp enough to cut like a blade
examples: The invitation card was edged with gold foil trim
Her dress was edged with delicate lace at the collar
He carefully handled the edged tools in the workshop
The edged weapons were kept locked in a secure cabinet

definitions: feeling nervous, tense, or irritable often from stress or anticipation of something
having a bold, provocative, or unconventional quality that pushes boundaries in art or style
examples: She felt edgy waiting for the important phone call
The caffeine made him edgy and unable to concentrate
The band's edgy new sound challenged mainstream music conventions
Her edgy fashion choices always attracted attention at events

definitions: suitable or safe for eating without causing harm when consumed by humans
examples: Not all mushrooms in the forest are edible varieties
The cake decorations were made from edible flowers and gold

definitions: having been revised, corrected, or modified to improve clarity, accuracy, or quality
having been prepared for publication by selecting, arranging, and refining content for an audience
examples: The edited manuscript was much clearer than the first draft
She submitted the edited version with all grammatical errors fixed
The edited anthology included works by twenty different poets
He published an edited collection of historical letters and documents

definitions: relating to the process of editing or the work of editors in publishing
expressing opinions rather than just reporting facts, especially in journalism or media
examples: The editorial team worked late to meet the publication deadline
She made several editorial changes to improve the article's flow
The newspaper's editorial stance favored environmental protection policies
His editorial comments revealed a clear political bias

definitions: having received formal schooling or training resulting in knowledge and intellectual development
based on experience, knowledge, or informed reasoning rather than random guessing
examples: The educated workforce attracted many technology companies to the area
She came from an educated family where everyone attended university
He made an educated guess about the test results
Their educated decision was based on thorough market research

definitions: serving to educate or provide instruction that increases knowledge or develops skills
examples: The museum offers educative programs for school children
Reading historical fiction can be both entertaining and educative

definitions: strange and frightening in a way that makes you feel nervous or uncomfortable
examples: An eerie silence fell over the abandoned house at midnight
The fog created an eerie atmosphere in the empty streets

definitions: having been brought about, accomplished, or caused to happen as a result of action
examples: The effected changes improved employee morale significantly
The newly effected policies reduced pollution in the city

definitions: having characteristics traditionally associated with women rather than men in appearance, manner, or behavior
examples: His effeminate gestures made him stand out among his peers
The actor's effeminate voice suited the character he was playing

definitions: giving off bubbles of gas, especially carbon dioxide, as in carbonated drinks
showing liveliness, enthusiasm, and excitement in an attractive, bubbly way like champagne
examples: The effervescent tablets dissolved quickly in water
She ordered an effervescent drink to celebrate the occasion
Her effervescent personality made her the life of every party
The comedian's effervescent humor kept the audience laughing constantly

definitions: successful in producing a desired or intended result, especially in medicine or treatment
examples: The new drug proved efficacious in treating the rare disease
Regular exercise is efficacious for maintaining good health

definitions: flowing out or forth, especially relating to liquid waste discharged from industrial processes
examples: The factory's effluent waste was carefully monitored for pollutants
Effluent water from the treatment plant met environmental standards

definitions: requiring no physical or mental exertion to accomplish, appearing easy and natural
examples: Her effortless grace on the dance floor amazed everyone
He made the difficult piano piece look completely effortless

definitions: expressing feelings of gratitude, pleasure, or approval in an unrestrained, heartfelt, and enthusiastic way
examples: She gave effusive thanks for the unexpected birthday surprise
His effusive praise made the young artist blush with pride

definitions: believing in or based on the principle that all people deserve equal rights and opportunities
examples: The company promoted an egalitarian workplace culture for all employees
Her egalitarian views influenced the new education policy

definitions: thinking only of oneself without consideration for others' feelings, needs, or desires
examples: His egocentric behavior alienated many of his former friends
The egocentric child refused to share toys with others

definitions: excessively conceited or absorbed in oneself, showing an inflated sense of self-importance
examples: The egotistical actor demanded special treatment on set
Her egotistical remarks about her achievements annoyed colleagues

definitions: outstandingly bad or shocking in a way that is very noticeable and unacceptable
examples: The report revealed egregious violations of safety regulations
His egregious error cost the company millions of dollars

definitions: being one more than seven in number, represented by the numeral 8
examples: The octopus has eight tentacles extending from its body
She works eight hours every day at the office

definitions: being one more than seventeen in number, represented by the numeral 18
examples: You must be eighteen years old to vote in elections
The golf course has eighteen holes for a full round

definitions: coming after the seventeenth in position, time, or order in a sequence
examples: Her eighteenth birthday party was a memorable celebration
The eighteenth century saw major scientific and philosophical advances

definitions: being eight times as great or as many in amount or degree
consisting of eight parts, aspects, or divisions arranged together as a whole
examples: The company experienced an eightfold increase in online sales
Investment returns showed eightfold growth over ten years
Buddhism teaches the eightfold path to enlightenment
The crystal displayed an eightfold symmetry in its structure

definitions: coming after the seventh in position, time, or order in a sequence
being one of eight equal parts into which something is divided
examples: She finished eighth in the marathon despite her injury
The eighth grade students prepared for their graduation ceremony
He ate only an eighth of the pizza before feeling full
An eighth note in music lasts half a quarter note

definitions: coming after the seventy-ninth in position, time, or order in a sequence
examples: They celebrated their grandfather's eightieth birthday with family
The eightieth anniversary of the company featured special events

definitions: being ten more than seventy in number, represented by the numeral 80
examples: The temperature reached eighty degrees on the sunny afternoon
She lived to be eighty years old and saw many changes

definitions: involving many carefully arranged parts or details that are developed with great care and complexity
examples: The wedding featured elaborate decorations with thousands of flowers
She wore an elaborate costume with intricate beadwork and embroidery

definitions: having been developed, expanded, or worked out in careful detail with additional information
examples: The elaborated plans included contingencies for every possible scenario
Her elaborated theory built upon earlier research in the field

definitions: having passed or slipped by, especially referring to time that has gone by
examples: Three hours had elapsed since the meeting began
The elapsed time between calls was carefully recorded

definitions: able to stretch and return to original shape without permanent deformation
able to change and adapt easily to different circumstances or requirements
examples: The elastic waistband made the pants comfortable to wear
Rubber bands are elastic and can stretch several times their length
The company maintained elastic policies to accommodate different situations
Market demand proved more elastic than economists had predicted

definitions: feeling extremely happy and excited because of success or good news
examples: She felt elated after receiving the job offer
The team was elated by their unexpected victory

definitions: being the oldest of three or more people, especially children in a family
examples: The eldest daughter inherited the family business
As the eldest child, he felt responsible for his siblings

definitions: chosen for a position or office through a formal voting process by a group
examples: The newly elected president gave an inspiring inaugural speech
She was elected to serve on the school board

definitions: relating to or chosen by election through voting rather than appointment or inheritance
available as a choice but not required, especially referring to courses or medical procedures
examples: The elective offices included mayor and city council positions
Judges in some states hold elective rather than appointed positions
Students must take three elective courses to complete their degree
The surgery was elective, not medically necessary

definitions: causing sudden excitement, thrill, or arousal as if by an electric shock
examples: The band's electrifying performance energized the entire crowd
Her electrifying speech inspired the audience to take action
